noun.description: A person opposed to new technology or ways of working.
examples: I'm not a Luddite, after all I work with the Internet for my job

noun.description: A member of any of the bands of English workers who destroyed machinery, especially in cotton and woolen mills, that they believed was threatening their jobs (1811–16).

adjective.description: Opposed to new technology or ways of working.
examples: this bill is really a Luddite approach to science
there'll still be plenty of Luddite customers like me who are yet to embrace the future

adjective.description: Denoting or relating to the 19th-century Luddites who destroyed machinery that they believed was threatening their jobs.

origin: Early 19th century: perhaps named after Ned Lud, a participant in the destruction of machinery, + -ite.
